intro: Lastrea subandina, commonly known as the Andean lastrea, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous regions, thriving in cool, high-altitude environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, adapted to withstand harsh weather conditions. The flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in dense clusters, making it a notable ornamental plant in alpine gardens.
